definitions.definition: Closing and forbidding entry, as a lockout in which management prevents works from working.
examples: A shutout is a reverse strike: the union complained and the workers wanted to work, but management was opposed.

definitions.definition: A game that ends with the losing side being held scoreless.
examples: The score wasn't just lopsided: it was a shutout .

main_definition: Closing and forbidding entry, as a lockout in which management prevents works from working.
secondary_definitions: ( sports ) A game that ends with the losing side being held scoreless.
